Interface MyApi


  • public interface MyApi
    The MyApi library. (MySQL and SQLite library)
    Since:
    November 16, 2015
    Version:
    1.3
    Author:
    como89

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(java.lang.String host,
          int port,
          java.lang.String userName,
          java.lang.String password,
          java.lang.String databaseName)
        This method will initialize the connection information.
        Parameters:
        host - - The Mysql server host.
        port - - The Mysql server port.
        userName - - The username of mysql server.
        password - - The password of the username.
        databaseName - - The database name.

      • init

        void init(java.lang.String path)
        This method will initialize the SQLite connection.
        Parameters:
        path - - The path with the file name and his extension.

      • connect

        ApiResponse connect()
             throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                    java.sql.SQLException
        This method will connect the library with the mysql server or SQLite file.
        Returns:
        ApiResponse, SUCCESS - if the operation success. ERROR, if a sql error happen. MYSQL_NOT_CONNECT, if the library is not connected with the mysql server. MYAPI_NOT_INITIALISE, if the library is not initialise correctly.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - - When not found the class of jdbc.
        java.sql.SQLException - - SQL problems, connection not found.

      • disconnect

        ApiResponse disconnect()
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method will disconnect the library with the mysql server or SQLite file.
        Returns:
        ApiResponse, SUCCESS - if the operation success. ERROR, if a sql error happen. MYSQL_NOT_CONNECT, if the library is not connected with the mysql server. MYAPI_NOT_INITIALISE, if the library is not initialise correctly.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - - SQL problems, connection not found.

      • isConnect

        ApiResponse isConnect()
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method will check if the library is connected with the mysql server or SQLite file.
        Returns:
        ApiResponse, MYSQL_NOT_CONNECT, if the library is not connected with the mysql server. MYAPI_NOT_INITIALISE, if the library is not initialise correctly. DATABASE_CONNECTED, if the library is connected to the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - - SQL problems, connection not found.

      • createTable

        ApiResponse createTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                        java.util.List<Columns> listcolumns,
                        boolean existCondition)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will create a Table with the name and the columns.
        Parameters:
        tableName - - The name of the table.
        listcolumns - - The list of the Columns.
        existCondition - - If you want to verify if the table exist.
        Returns:
        ApiResponse, SUCCESS - if the operation success. ERROR, if a sql error happen. MYSQL_NOT_CONNECT, if the library is not connected with the mysql server. MYAPI_NOT_INITIALISE, if the library is not initialise correctly.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If the parameters are null.

      • deleteTable

        ApiResponse deleteTable(java.lang.String tableName)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will delete a Table with the name.
        Parameters:
        tableName - - The name of the table.
        Returns:
        ApiResponse, SUCCESS - if the operation success. ERROR, if a sql error happen. MYSQL_NOT_CONNECT, if the library is not connected with the mysql server. MYAPI_NOT_INITIALISE, if the library is not initialise correctly.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If the parameter is null.

      • insertValues

        ApiResponse insertValues(TableProperties tableProperties)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         LengthTableException,
                         java.sql.SQLException
        This method will insert values with what you have specified in the tableProperties.
        Parameters:
        tableProperties - - The TableProperties object.
        Returns:
        ApiResponse, SUCCESS - if the operation success. ERROR, if a sql error happen. MYSQL_NOT_CONNECT, if the library is not connected with the mysql server. MYAPI_NOT_INITIALISE, if the library is not initialise correctly.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If the parameter is null.
        LengthTableException - - if the tables are not the same lenght.
        java.sql.SQLException - - SQL problems, connection not found.

      • updateValues

        ApiResponse updateValues(TableProperties tableProperties,
                         Condition condition)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         LengthTableException
        This method will update values with what you have specified in the tableProperties and with the condition.
        Parameters:
        tableProperties - - The tableProperties object.
        condition - - The Condition object.
        Returns:
        ApiResponse, SUCCESS - if the operation success. ERROR, if a sql error happen. MYSQL_NOT_CONNECT, if the library is not connected with the mysql server. MYAPI_NOT_INITIALISE, if the library is not initialise correctly.
        Throws:
        LengthTableException - - if the tables are not the same lenght.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If the parameter is null.

      • selectValues

        TableData selectValues(TableProperties tableProperties,
                       Condition condition)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       LengthTableException
        This method will select values with what you have specified in the tableProperties and with the condition.
        Parameters:
        tableProperties - - The TableProperties object.
        condition - -The condition object. (Not neccessary, can be null)
        Returns:
        TableData - You can get values and get response from the api.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If the parameter is null.
        LengthTableException - - if the tables are not the same lenght.

      • deleteRow

        ApiResponse deleteRow(java.lang.String tableName,
                      Condition condition)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will delete rows in the tableName and with the condition.
        Parameters:
        tableName - - The table name.
        condition - - The condition object.
        Returns:
        ApiResponse, SUCCESS - if the operation success. ERROR, if a sql error happen. MYSQL_NOT_CONNECT, if the library is not connected with the mysql server. MYAPI_NOT_INITIALISE, if the library is not initialise correctly.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If a parameter is null.

      • addColumns

        ApiResponse addColumns(java.lang.String tableName,
                       java.util.List<Columns> listColumns,
                       boolean hisIgnore)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will add columns in the tableName.
        Parameters:
        tableName - - The table name.
        listColumns - - List of the columns.
        hisIgnore - - If true, do a copy of the table and restore data, after the modification.
        Returns:
        ApiResponse, SUCCESS - if the operation success. ERROR, if a sql error happen. MYSQL_NOT_CONNECT, if the library is not connected with the mysql server. MYAPI_NOT_INITIALISE, if the library is not initialise correctly.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If a parameter is null.

      • changeColumn

        ApiResponse changeColumn(java.lang.String tableName,
                         java.lang.String oldColumnName,
                         Columns newColumn,
                         boolean hisIgnore)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will change the column in parameter.
        Parameters:
        tableName - - The table name.
        oldColumnName - - The old column name.
        newColumn - - The new column.
        hisIgnore - - If true, do a copy of the table and restore data, after the modification.
        Returns:
        ApiResponse, SUCCESS - if the operation success. ERROR, if a sql error happen. MYSQL_NOT_CONNECT, if the library is not connected with the mysql server. MYAPI_NOT_INITIALISE, if the library is not initialise correctly.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If a parameter is null.

      • removeColumn

        ApiResponse removeColumn(java.lang.String tableName,
                         java.lang.String columnName,
                         boolean hisIgnore)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will remove the column in parameter.
        Parameters:
        tableName - - The table name.
        columnName - - The column name.
        hisIgnore - - If true, do a copy of the table and restore data, after the modification.
        Returns:
        ApiResponse, SUCCESS - if the operation success. ERROR, if a sql error happen. MYSQL_NOT_CONNECT, if the library is not connected with the mysql server. MYAPI_NOT_INITIALISE, if the library is not initialise correctly.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - If a parameter is null.
